title: PBE: Sated Devourer?

embed.description: This is a W ORK I N P ROGRESS POST - check back for constant updates now that today's patch out.][ Status: The PBE currently still down for maintenance.] The PBE has been updated! Continue reading for more information! ( Warning: PBE Content is tentative and iterative - what you see may not reflect what eventually gets pushed to live servers!

body:
-Now becomes "Sated " at 30 stacks.

-Base magic damage on hit increased to 30 from 25

 -Passive Changed to "Devouring Spirit" - Takedowns on Larg monsters and champions increase magic damage by +1. Takedowns on epic monsters increased by +5

-When Sated, every other basic attack will trigger on Hit effects twice. 


What is everyone thoughts on this?

{{champion:11}} **Heavy Breathing**

I checked a video, and stacks towards Yi passive also counts as an on-hit. This means Yi will proc double on-hits on literally every auto attack with this item.

I could be wrong, but I think the on-hit effects here refer to the on-hit from devourer, and not every single on-hit effect the champion auto applies. If that's the case, Yi's passive would just allow 1 extra devourer proc every 4 autos, which isn't that op.

Nope, it's all on-hit effects, including those from other items (such as {{item:3153}}) and champion abilities (such as {{champion:11}}'s E or Passive). The point of it is to give the champion more scaling rather than just more straight up stats (such as if it gave extra AD for example).

Yi- AA: passive gains one stack, E is applied, BotRK is applied, Q cd is reduced by one second> AA2: passive gains two stacks(3rd), E and BotRK are applied 2x, and Q cd is reduced by 2 secs> AA3+doublehit: (AA3)E/BotRK are applied, Q cd reduced by one sec then (passive hit) E/BotRK hit 2x, Q cd reduced by 2 secs, and two stacks of passive are applied. After this, Yi will get his passive hit every other attack for a total of 2.5 AD and 4 on-hit applications every two hits. The first 3 AAs will have a total 3.5 AD(remember divided by 3 AAs) ratio and apply 6 on-hit applications(3 AAs, one passive hit, 2 sated procs). I'm not really sure how this will interact with his passive counter after the first three hits because it might not count up until after his passive strike.

Regardless of how it will work after stacking(maybe every hit, maybe not) this means that a Yi that attacks someone 5 times(2 seconds at AS cap) would apply 600%AD worth of AA damage and 10 on-hit applications. This might open up on-hit bruiser builds to him again, but it will definitely make the best scaling assassin who can also bust tanks if not locked down or burst down. 10 on-hits in 2.5 seconds will reset Qs cd if you have somewhere shy of 20% cdr. I'm kind of concerned that something like this might make him too broken, but it does require a wind up period.

Either way, he is one of my absolute favorite champs to play and I relish anything that would make him less of a troll pick in the current meta.

edit: The terminology and stack gains have been altered. A Takedown is a kill or assist. Currently Devourer grants 2 stacks for a takedown on a champ, and 1 stack for a large monster kill (not assists).

The new language reduces the champion takedown bonus to 1, increases epic monster takedowns (kills+assists) to 5, and 1 stack for takedowns (includes assists again) for large monsters.

It seems to me the new item will benefit greatly from killing Dragon because assists count.

As you know, WW is more than capable of taking Dragon solo at very early points in the game. Doing so with Devourer would benefit him greatly because +5 magic damage. Also, this mechanic would greatly benefit having multiple devourers on a team because everyone wielding a Devourer enchantment would get +5 stacks assuming they participated in the takedown.
